name: Baby
description: Sign representing a baby or infant.
usage: Used to talk about a baby.
instruction: Cradle your hands as if holding a baby.

name: Bye
usage: Used when leaving or ending a conversation.
instruction: Wave your hand back and forth.

name: Child
usage: Used when referring to a child.
instruction: Place both hands in front of you, patting downward.

name: Cigarette
usage: Used to refer to smoking or cigarettes.
instruction: Hold your fingers as if holding a cigarette and bring it near your mouth.

name: Cloth
usage: Used when referring to fabric or cloth.
instruction: Rub your fingers together as if smoothing fabric.

name: Drink
usage: Used when talking about drinking liquids.
instruction: Pretend to hold a cup and bring it to your mouth.

name: Food
instruction: Bring fingers to your mouth as if eating.

name: Hi
instruction: Wave your hand with fingers spread.

name: Say
usage: Used when referring to saying something.

name: Thirsty
usage: Used to indicate needing a drink.
instruction: Draw finger down your throat as if indicating thirst.
